page.title: 20Language - Iaith.
page.content: The language of the majority of the people living in the area is Welsh. People go about their daily lives through the medium of Welsh, in work, at play and children at school learn mainly through using the Welsh language. During recent years more English families have moved into the area as owners of second homes or have moved in and settled here. Over the years the Welsh people have become bilingual and children at school find little difficulty in mastering both languages by the age of eleven. Welsh is widely used and is strongly reflected in the culture and pastimes of people in the area.However the number of Welsh speakers is declining but there is a strong awareness for the need to preserve our language.
